definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Wanting to do him dirt, she sent his wife a poison-pen letter.
sentences.chinese: 施诡计就写了一封恶意中伤的信给他的妻子。

sentences.english: Slander , the viper , has wrongfully accused me.
sentences.chinese: 谣言这条毒蛇对我进行了恶意中伤。

sentences.english: I gave my ear to what I now know was the malice of slander .
sentences.chinese: 我过去听信了谣言，现在我知道那是恶意中伤。

sentences.english: Sometimes it's difficult to draw a line between backbiting and malicious gossip.
sentences.chinese: 有时很难区分诽谤和恶意中伤。

sentences.english: But much of the venom in the press, at any rate, is directed at big multinationals.
sentences.chinese: 然，媒体的许多恶意中伤，矛头直指大的跨国公司。

sentences.english: It is not easy to traduce his character.
sentences.chinese: 恶意中伤他人是不对的。

sentences.english: The candidate was viciously slurred by his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 候选人遭到对手恶意中伤。

sentences.english: His reputation was bespattered by malicious gossip.
sentences.chinese: 他的声誉遭到恶意中伤的诋毁。

sentences.english: I think these rumours are mischievous.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这些谣言是恶意中伤的。

definition: variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to start rumours and create trouble
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to hurl abuse/to deride/to call sb names
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to attack someone by innuendo (idiom)/to make oblique charges/to make insinuations/to insinuate
